pull.title: add constant for shared (GUI/core) -par settings
pull.body:
- introduce DEFAULT_SCRIPTCHECK_THREADS in main.h
- only show values from -"MAX_HW_THREADS" up to 16 for -par, as it
  makes no sense to try to leave more "cores free" than the system
  supports anyway
- use the new constant in optionsdialog and remove defaults from
  .ui file

events.body: Please use DEFAULT_SCRIPTCHECK_THREADS in the optionsmodel as well: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/qt/optionsmodel.cpp#L93
@laanwj I had this in my local branch but not pushed :). I also ensured that ordering matches tab ordering (so the diff is mostly a move in optionsmodel.cpp).

issue.title: [Qt] fix style, formating, comment and indentation problems

events.body: Needs rebase after #3619 due to reordering of command line help

events.message:
add constant for shared (GUI/core) -par settings

- introduce DEFAULT_SCRIPTCHECK_THREADS in main.h
- only show values from -"MAX_HW_THREADS" up to 16 for -par, as it
  makes no sense to try to leave more "cores free" than the system
  supports anyway
- use the new constant in optionsdialog and remove defaults from
  .ui file

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/5409404d7585d45b5d4a7142171f138c213e6e19 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

comments.body: I prefer not defining this and just using boost::thread::hardware_concurrency() where appropriate. No magic number is hardcoded here, we're just replacing the boost name with a name our own. Also this is not a constant, and not a maximum (you can use more threads than this, it likely won't help you much, but you can).
I changed it back, also the number of HW threads is just used to limit the negative number you can input to "leave cores free".

~~I don't think having 0 as maximum is useful :) Probably best to set no maximum, if we want to manually control the number of verification threads, there is no upper limit.~~
never mind, misread
